9/10: As global energy needs grow, a solution like space-based solar power collection and transmission could be a massive step forward. It could operate 24/7 and beam power to remote or disaster-stricken areas. #GreenTech #SpaceEnergy

5/10: How does it work? 

A device is collecting solar power with 2 panels (i.e. SSPD-1). The collected energy is then sent across a given distance using constructive and destructive interference through transmitters within the MAPLE. #SpaceEnergy #TechNews

3/10: The researchers confirmed that MAPLE‚Äôs transmitters beamed solar power collected in space to a receiver on the rooftop of Gordon and Betty Moore Laboratory of Engineering on Caltech‚Äôs campus in Pasadena. #CleanEnergy #SpaceTech

2/10: The experiment is part of Caltech's Space Solar Power Project, and the successful transmission was announced via a press release. 

The tech used was the "Microwave Array for Power-transfer Low-orbit Experiment" (i.e. MAPLE). #RenewableEnergy #Innovation

1/10: The team has achieved a first by successfully beaming solar power from space to Earth without a single wire. This is a huge leap in space-based power!
